means: 草图
素描
梗概
草拟
速写
简述
[人名] 斯凯奇

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"描写，描述"之意。
means: describe ： 侧重指描述细节，给读者或听众提供清晰的视觉图像。
represent ： 指有代表性或象征性地描述或讲述。
sketch ： 指快速地勾勒或概略地叙述。
picture ： 着重能够栩栩如生地把事物或场景等描绘出来。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些词既可作动词也可作名词用，作动词时均有"绘制"之意；作名词时都含"草图"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: draft, outline, diagram, plot, sketch, blueprint
means: draft ： 用作动词时指按准确比例设计或打样；作名词时专指精确的草图或草案。
outline ： 主要给出事物要点或轮廓，强调简化了的整体。
diagram ： 侧重指用图形、图表等来说明。
plot ： 可与draft和diagram换用，但侧重于表示具体的点、面、部分或目标，从而使相互关系以及和整体的关系得以明确。
sketch ： 指用图、模型或语言描述来表示某一事物的整体情况。
blueprint ： 主要指绘制蓝图或制定纲领或规划。这个词引申用来指详细而具体的行动计划。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都表示"画，图"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: drawing, illustration, cartoon, diagram, picture, sketch, painting, portrait
means: drawing ： 指用线条或色彩绘成的图画。
illustration ： 指插入书页之间帮助说明的任何插图或图解。
cartoon ： 指幽默或讽刺性漫画。
diagram ： 多指科技书籍或文献中具有概括解说作用的图表、图样或略图。
picture ： 指广义的"图画"，现多用来指相片、画像。
sketch ： 通常指只画出物体主要特征的图画。
painting ： 指着色的画。
portrait ： 指肖像，只用于指人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Dutch schets or German Skizze, from Italian schizzo, from schizzare 'make a sketch', based on Greek skhedios 'done extempore'

entry.def: A sketch is a drawing that is done quickly without a lot of details. Artists often use sketches as a preparation for a more detailed painting or drawing.

example.ex: ...a sketch of a soldier by Orpen.
example.tran: 奥彭所画的一幅士兵素描

entry.def: If you sketch something, you make a quick, rough drawing of it.

example.ex: Clare and David Astor are sketching a view of far Spanish hills...
example.tran: 克莱尔和戴维·阿斯特正在画远处西班牙山峦的风景素描。

example.ex: I always sketch with pen and paper.
example.tran: 我总是用钢笔和纸画素描。

entry.def: A sketch of a situation, person, or incident is a brief description of it without many details.

example.ex: ...thumbnail sketches of heads of state and political figures...
example.tran: 对国家元首和政治人物的简略叙述

example.ex: I had a basic sketch of a plan.
example.tran: 我有一个基本的计划框架。

entry.def: If you sketch a situation or incident, you give a short description of it, including only the most important facts.

example.ex: Cross sketched the story briefly, telling the facts just as they had happened.
example.tran: 克罗斯简要地叙述了事情的经过，把当时发生的情况一五一十地说了一遍。

entry.tran: (通常指喜剧节目中的)幽默短剧
entry.def: A sketch is a short humorous piece of acting, usually forming part of a comedy show.

example.ex: ...a five-minute sketch about a folk singer.
example.tran: 刻画一位民歌手的 5 分钟幽默短剧

sentences.sentence: "he made several studies before starting to paint"

means.word_mean: 4. a humorous or satirical drawing published in a newspaper or magazine
2. describe roughly or briefly or give the main points or summary of;

means.word_mean: 草图; 素描; 速写

sentences.en: I will send you a slight sketch of the house.
sentences.cn: 我将给你寄去房屋的草图。

sentences.en: Give me a sketch of your plan.
sentences.cn: 跟我谈谈你的计划梗概。

sentences.en: My sister often goes into the country to sketch.
sentences.cn: 我姐姐常到乡间去写生。

sentences.en: The historical article sketched the major events of the decade.
sentences.cn: 这篇有关历史的文章概述了这十年中的重大事件。

jushi.english: Give me a sketch of your plan.
jushi.chinese: 跟我谈谈你的计划梗概。

jushi.english: I will send you a slight sketch of the house.
jushi.chinese: 我将给你寄去房屋的草图。

jushi.english: He made a sketch of the tower.
jushi.chinese: 他给那座塔作了一幅素描。
